LifeCycleState description: RQ1 Method Description 6. Life Cycle States and Transitions p.117

A problem was indicated by somebody, the attribute “LifeCycleState Comment” holds the reason. The Issue/release/workitem must be clarified. 

The tool will send automatic email if there is no due date or the date is overdue in the LifeCycleStateComment until when the issue will be kept in conflicted. Date format: DD.MM.YYYY

Considered Elements LifeCycleState = Conflicted,

1.3.0 - Issue/release/workitem is still in "Conflicted" state:
// rule affects only conflicted I-SWs
if issueSW/issueFD/BCrelease/FCrelease/workitem.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE != CONFLICTED then
    return
end if

// retrieve last due date from life cycle state comment field
if issueSW/issueFD/BCrelease/FCrelease/workitem.lastDueDate = null then
    Warning "No due date found in life cycle state comment field. LifeCycleState " + issueSW/issueFD/BCrelease/FCrelease/workitem.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE + " I-SW/I-FD/BC-R/FC-R/WI does not contain a due date in life cycle state comment field."   
    return
end if
  
if issueSW/issueFD/BCrelease/FCrelease/workitem.lastDueDate = isInThePast then
    Warning "Due date found in life cycle state comment field is in the past. LifeCycleState " + issueSW/issueFD/BCrelease/FCrelease/workitem.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE + " I-SW/I-FD/BC-R/FC-R/WI due date in life cycle state comment field is in the past."
end if

Unnamed: 4: Not all fields for defect detection/injection attributes in a Bug Fix Issue (IFD) are filled

RQ1 Method Description 4.3. Defect Handling p.51

Issue FD (only for BugFix Issues: 
- Defect detection attributes of Defect Flow model
  (Defect Detection Location, Defect Detection Process, Defect Detection Organisation, Defect Detection Date), 
- During defect resolution (issue implementation): all defect correction attributes
  (Defective Work Product Type, Defect Classification, Defect Injection Organisation, Defect Injection Date). 

Considered Issues: Category Defect, 
Defect detection attributes,Occurrence, Severity:
Issues LifeCycleState:                              Evaluated, Committed, Implemented, !=Canceled, != Conflicted
Defect correction attributes Issues LifeCycleState: Evaluated, Committed, Implemented, !=Canceled, != Conflicted

3.1.0_I_SW - Not all fields for defect detection/injection attributes in a Bug Fix Issue (ISW) are filled:
// rule is NOT for canceled or conflicted ISWs
if issueSW = canceledOrConflicted then
    return
end if

// rule affects only ISWs with category "Defect"
if issueSW.CATEGORY != DEFECT then
    return
end if

// check if ANY of the defect detection attributes is empty
if issueSW.DEFECT_DETECTION_LOCATION = null || issueSW.DEFECT_DETECTION_PROCESS = null || issueSW.DEFECT_DETECTION_ORGANISATION = null || issueSW.DEFECT_DETECTION_DATE = null then
    Warning "Defect detection attributes are not completely filled out. LifeCycleState " + issueSW.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE + "At least one of the following fields is empty:" + "Defect Detection Location, Defect Detection Process, Defect Detection Organisation, Defect Detection Date"
end if

// check if occurrence or severity is empty
if issueSW.OCCURRENCE = null || issueSW.SEVERITY = null then
 Warning "Occurrence or Severity are not completely filled out. LifeCycleState " + issueSW.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE.getValueAsText() + "At least one of the following fields is empty:" + "Occurrence, Severity"
end if

if issueSW.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE != NEW then 
// check of defect correction attributes is omitted, if defective work product type is "Supplied Work Product"
    if issueSW.DEFECT_WORKPRODUCT_TYPE != SUPPLIED_WORK_PRODUCT then
        // check if ANY of the defect correction attributes is empty
        if issueSW.DEFECT_WORKPRODUCT_TYPE = null  || issueSW.DEFECT_CLASSIFICATION.getValue() = null || issueSW.DEFECT_INJECTION_ORGANISATION.getValue() = null || issueSW.DEFECT_INJECTION_DATE.getValue() = null then
   Warning "Defect correction attributes are not completely filled out. LifeCycleState " + issueSW.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE + "Defective Work Product Type " + issueSW.DEFECT_WORKPRODUCT_TYPE + "At least one of the following fields is empty:"+ "Defective Work Product Type, Defect Classification, Defect Injection Organisation, Defect Injection Date"
        end if
 end if
end if


3.1.0_I_FD - Not all fields for defect detection/injection attributes in a Bug Fix Issue (IFD) are filled:
// rule is NOT for canceled or conflicted IFDs
if issueFD = canceledOrConflicted then
    return
end if

// rule affects only IFDs with category "Defect"
if issueFD.CATEGORY != DEFECT then
    return
end if

// check if ANY of the defect detection attributes is empty
if issueFD.DEFECT_DETECTION_LOCATION = null || issueFD.DEFECT_DETECTION_PROCESS = null || issueFD.DEFECT_DETECTION_ORGANISATION = null || issueFD.DEFECT_DETECTION_DATE = null then
 Warning "Defect detection attributes are not completely filled out. LifeCycleState " + issueFD.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE + "At least one of the following fields is empty:" + "Defect Detection Location, Defect Detection Process, Defect Detection Organisation, Defect Detection Date"
end if

// check of defect correction attributes is omitted for new IFDs
if issueFD.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE != LifeCycleState_Issue.NEW then
 // check if ANY of the defect correction attributes is empty
    if issueFD.DEFECT_WORKPRODUCT_TYPE = null || issueFD.DEFECT_CLASSIFICATION = null || issueFD.DEFECT_INJECTION_ORGANISATION = null || issueFD.DEFECT_INJECTION_DATE = null then
  Warning "Defect correction attributes are not completely filled out. LifeCycleState " + issueFD.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE + "At least one of the following fields is empty:" + "Defective Work Product Type, Defect Classification, Defect Injection Organisation, Defect Injection Date"
 end if
end if

Unnamed: 4: BC without mapping to PVER or PFAM

Unnamed: 5: Project - RQ1 Planing (optional)

Checks that BC is mapped to a PVER or PFAM.
The warning 'BC not linked to any PVER/PFAM.' is set on the BC, if no mapping exists.

Note:
This check is only performed for BCs in life cycle state 'Requested' and 'Planned'.
Project - RQ1 Planing (optional)

Checks that a FC comes in time for a BC.

The following warnings are set on the RRM:
a) 'No planned date set for FC.'
b) 'No planned date set for BC.'
c) 'FC planned date too late for BC requested delivery date.'
d) 'FC planned date too late for BC planned date.'

About d: Check is only done, if requested delivery date is not set in RRM.

This rule is only applied if the LifeCycleStates of the RRM is REQUESTED or PLANNED.

Unnamed: 4: Check dates for PVER, BC and FC

Unnamed: 5: Project - RQ1 Planing (optional)

The dates for PVER, BC and FC are checked against the following rules:

For life cycle state REQUESTED:
- If a Planning Freeze is set, then it has to be in the future or today.
- If a Implementation Freeze is set, then it has to be in the future or today.
- Planned Date must be set and in the future or today.

For life cycle state PLANNED:
- If a Implementation Freeze is set, then it has to be in the future or today.
- Planned Date must be set and in the future or today.

For life cycle state DEVELOPED:
- Planned Date must be set and in the future or today.

For life cycle states NEW, CLOSED, CANCELLED and CONFLICTED:
- No dates are checked.
Project - RQ1 Planing
RQ1 Method Description: 4.1.2.1. Order Evaluation(s) from Function Development (Issue FDs) p.39 (at the moment used in rare cases)

Typically the evaluation results shall be provided by Function Development within 5 work days. 
In such case, the explicit provision of an evaluation deadline can be skipped. An evaluation deadline can be defined as 

<EvaluationRequiredBy>DD.MM.YYYY<\EvaluationRequiredBy> The evaluation date has to be defined by the requestor.

Estimate the effort for the Issue FD and set to Evaluated within 5 days after forwarded to Funtion Development or till the evaluation deadline defined

Considered issue FD LifeCycleState  = New

2.1.0 - IFD 5 day SLA reached:
if issueFD.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE != NEW then
 return
end if

// if evaluation date is provided
if evaluationDate != null && evaluationDate != empty then 
 if evaluationDate = isInThePast then
  Warning "Not evaluated after evaluation date. LifeCycleState " + issueFD.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE + " after evaluation date (" + evaluationDate + ")."
    end if
else
 // if forward date is available
 if forwardDate != null then
  if forwardDate+7 = inThePast then  //(Date + 7 days) in the past - or 5 working days
            Warning "Not evaluated after forward date plus 5 working business days. LifeCycleState " + issueFD.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE + " after forward date plus 5 working business days (" + forwardDate+7 + ")."
        end if    
 // if forward date is NOT available
 else  
        if submitDate+7 = inThePast then
            Warning "Not evaluated after submit date plus 5 working business days. LifeCycleState " + issueFD.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE + " after submit date plus 5 working business days (" + submitDate+7 + ")."
        end if
 end if
end if

Unnamed: 4: IFD is not implemented or closed, after planned dated of BC-R

Unnamed: 5: Project - RQ1 Planing

Target level for checking: 
RQ1 Method Description 4.2.5.Implement an Issue FD p.48
The Issue FD is implemented once all related components for a pilot implementation are developed and qualified
(e.g. two different package alternatives requested with same Issue FD, Issue FD is evaluated when implemented in at least one BC alternative)
(Issue Impleneted mit Implemetation Freeze)

The tool will take planned date of mapped BC releases,  which are in “Planned” or “Developed”, to verify check. The issue will be remarked if the issue FD is not in Implemented Phase, but the first BC - Release has already closed.

Considered issue FD LifeCycleState  <= Implemented  & != Closed, != Canceled, !=Conflicted

2.3.0 - IFD is not implemented or closed, after planned dated of BC-R:
// rule is NOT for canceled or conflicted IFDs
if issueFD = canceledOrConflicted then
    return
end if

// rule affects only IFDs with life cycle state "COMITTED"
if issueFD.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE != COMMITTED then
    return
end if

if firstPlannedDate = null then
    return
end if

// threshold for implementation is first planned date
if firstPlannedDate = inThePast then
    Warning "Not implemented after first planned date. LifeCycleState" + issueFD.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE + " after first planned date (" + firstPlannedDate.toString() + ")."
end if

Project - RQ1 Planing - Element Integrity (optional)

For all Lifecyle state values != INBERAB

The title of a FC has to fit to one of the following formats:

a) FC     : <FunctionName> / <VersionNumber>
b) FCC    : <FunctionName> / <VersionNumber>
c) FCL    : <FunctionName> / <VersionNumber>
d) FCP    : <FunctionName> / <VersionNumber>
e) FC-ARA : <FunctionName> / <VersionNumber>
f) FC-ARB : <FunctionName> / <VersionNumber>
g) FX     : <FunctionName> / <VersionNumber>

<FunctionName> ... has to start with a character and may continue with characters and digits and underlines.

<VersionNumber> ... is a series of numbers, characters and underlines seperated by dots.
The FC is marked with the warning 'Invalid Title', if the name does not met this format.
Unnamed: 14: ggf. Anpassung in RQ1 - Namenskonvention kann direkt im Tool überprüft werden

Unnamed: 5: Project - RQ1 Planing - Element Integrity (optional)

For all Lifecyle state values != INBERAB

The title of a BC has to fit to one of the following formats:

a) BC    : <PackageName> / <VersionNumber>
b) BC_MO : <PackageName> / <VersionNumber>
c) BCC   : <PackageName> / <VersionNumber>
d) BX    : <PackageName> / <VersionNumber>
e) CEL   : <PackageName> / <VersionNumber>
f) CC    : <PackageName> / <VersionNumber>

<PackageName> ... Only characters allowed.

<VersionNumber> ... has to start with number continued by series of numbers, characters and underlines seperated by dots.

The BC is marked with the warning 'Invalid Title', if the name does not fit to this format

Unnamed: 5: Project - RQ1 Planing - Element Integrity (optional)

RQ1 Method Description 
4.1.5.Close an Issue SW p41.

Change requests shall be tracked until closure. 
The issues shall be a remarked issue if the function development is finished and at least one/all IRM(s) are qualified, however the issue SW is not impleneted or closed.

The Issue SW responsible shall set the Issue SW Lifecycle State to Closed or implemented.

Function Development Done      [All related Issue FDs are at minimum “Implemented” (or already “Closed)]
All PVER-F Done                                [All IRMs of Issue SW are set to “Qualified”]

- Function Development Done  &&  [All related Issue FDs are at closed]
- One PVER-F Done &&    [Minimum one IRM of Issue SW is set to “Qualified”]

Process: PVER Functional Test (PVER-F)

The issue release map (Issue SW - PVER) shall be remarked if the PVER-F testing is open however the BC have been already implemented in the PVER. 

PVER-F verifies the correct implementation of the Issue SW in the PVER is delivered to the customer

IRM (Issue SW - PVER)Implemented after plus 10 working business days  or PVER Planned Date is already in the past. 

QualificationStatus of the IRM with Failed or Not Required shall be ignored.

Warning "RQ1 PVER releases.LifecycleState: " + to be Closed
 end if

IRMs in Qualified state
//rule affects IRM lifecycle state

if IRM lifecycle state == QUALIFIED
flag = 1
return
 end if

else if
IRM lifecycle state == IMPLEMENTED
IRM state - PVER-F acceptance criteria = FAILED
flag = 2

if IRM lifecycle state == QUALIFIED
flag != 1 || flag !=2
#Warning
return
 end if

Project - ASpice MAN.3 - RQ1 and ILM
MAN.3 ruleset available in Proclib, VCC questionaire (detailed check criteria available)

(1) Check on milestone planning available with subphases in agreement with Customer milestones? Overall effort estimation for the project phases?

(2) Detailed Time schedule available, updated and tracked?   

(2) Does a clear definition for task exist ?  Scope, work break down, Consistency (Hint: Single task should not exceed 2 weeks duration)  How is the Task status maintained and tracked ? (Includes delegated tasks in extended teams )  How does the team handle the schedule delay issues arising during development phase? Escalation mechanism to be defined and followed? Are BCs delivered as per the planned BC delivery schedule ?

(1) and (2) ILM
check: existence of file formats .MPP, .xls, .xlsx, .ppt, .pptx under project folder ILM link --> 10_PM -> B-Mngt -> B5-Schedule
check: timestamps of documents, date not updated +/- 2 months from planned date of audit/check
check: versioning in ILM, status of document (valid) in ILM, other versions not to be in valid state

(2) RQ1
RQ1 automated check for BC releases (planned vs actual dates)
BC-R planned vs actual dates (DELAY)
//rule affects BC-R planning

if BC Release.LIFE_CYCLE_STATE !=NEW then
return
 end if

//planned vs actual delivery dates in RQ1
if actualdate - planneddate >= 5
Warning "DELAY in BC-R"
end if

Workitems to be created for Reviews and Testing tasks in RQ1 IssueFD (applicable for RbD ASPICE samples)
RQ1 automated check for Workitems
//ruleset for workitems created for review and testing tasks

Flow Method planning?
Check under I-FDs, 
if Workitem created with description title containing Review or Testing
if planned dates!= empty && if efforts <=64 hrs 
ok else Warning
